channel.title: AP Chemistry on
channel.description: Recent content in AP Chemistry on

item.title: Average Atomic Mass
item.description: Atomic Mass Unit: amu or u u = 1.660540 * 10$^-$$^2$$^7$ kg Mass of a proton ~ 1 u (atomic mass unit) Mass of a neutron ~ 1 u (atomic mass unit)

item.title: Calculate Mass %
item.description: How Find the molar mass of all of the compound Find the molar mass of the element who’s mass percent you are being told to find

item.title: Determine Empirical Formula % Comp
item.description: What If you were given to find the empirical formula using To learn what an empirical formula is refer to [[Empirical, molecular, and structural formulas]]

item.title: Determine empirical formula from combustion data
Empirical Molecular & Structural
item.description: Empirical formula Empirical formula gives you the element ratios Eg: Empirical formula of benzene is CH for every 1 carbon there’s 1 hydrogen

item.title: Isotopes
item.description: In chemistry you can have different versions of the same element which are known as Isotopes The relative abundance of an isotope is the percentage of atoms with a specific atomic mass found in a naturally occurring sample of an element.

item.title: Mass Spectrometry
item.description: Relative abundance of each isotope can be determined using mass spectrometry Video link on how mass spectrometry works Atoms that have the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons are known as isotopes.

item.title: Mole & Avogardo #
item.description: Avogadro’s Constant / Number Avogadro’s number: 6.02214076 * 10$^2$$^3$ often rounded to 6.022 * 10$^2$$^3$ Mole A mole is saying you have Avogadro number of something
